statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -3 \\ -9 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ -2 \\ -2 \\ 6 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -3 \\ -9 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ -2 \\ -2 \\ 6 \end{array}\right].
